result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Dennis Poler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Two (2) days jail creidt only if revoked. 
$443 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count #2.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court. Called 3:08 PM. FTR recorded. Called 15CF183, 15TR754 and 16CF62. Poler asks for $50/month payment. Court indicates needs $100/month. Poler agrees to that. Court orders $100/month payment, commencing 12/1/16.

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns. Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:53 PM. State - resolved - amend count #2 to possession of THC as 1st offense, plead G/NC to count #2 and #3 will be DRI, count #2 - $300 fine plus costs and #1 - costs only, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with other conditions include: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars, or similar class B establishments, employment/school, 30 hours of community service. Poler and Burns agree. Court dismisses and reads in count #3. Court amends count #2 to possession of THC contrary to 961.41(3g)(e)2. Poler pleads NC to count #2 as amended and #1 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Poler withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 30 hours of community service (total), costs on count #1 - paid thru probation; count #2 - $300 fine plus costs - paid thru probation on count #1, 2 days jail credit only if revoked, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:10 PM. State belives it is a waiver of PH. Burns and Poler agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG plea to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott Dennis Poler in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:28 AM. Burns and Poler have complaint, understands charges and penalties, waives reading of it, requests PH, will waive time limits. Burns - bond - requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - no objections. Court - bond - amends to $1000.00 signature bond with same conditions, refund bond posted.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
